Row.Text: You lead a strong and wealthy nation, Donald Trump, but it is your great ambition to make it stronger and wealthier still. Though your administration has begun under a cloud of controversy, you remain confident in your skill in the art of the deal that you can yet shape events to your will. Can you fulfill your promises, Mr. President, and make America great again?

China is growing, and it takes a steady hand, your hand, Xi Jinping, to steer the ship of state upon the proper course. You have learned from the mistakes of the past, and as you maneuver your nation into a position of global leadership you will never forget that true power comes through unquestioned strength. Lead your people well, and you may achieve your "Chinese Dream" of a more glorious nation.

The Motherland calls for leadership, Vladimir Putin, and it is your honor to answer the call. You seek to recapture the lost days of glory for your nation, returning it to its rightful place of influence on the world stage. You will not let others meddle in Russian affairs, but will fiercely guard your land, your people, and your allies.

You lead the world's largest democracy, Narendra Modi, and there are many competing interests you must try to balance as you guide your growing nation towards the future. As a reformer who also seeks to preserve the ancient traditions of your people, you have your work cut out for you. If you succeed, a more prosperous and unified India will arise.

More than most, Shinzo Abe, you recognize that Japan is a land of both tradition and progress. You respect the ways of your ancestors and take pride in your nation, but you realize the need for Japan to adapt in these changing times. Apply the lessons of the past to the problems of the present, and you may yet see Japan through to a glorious future.

You dare to dream of a united Europe, Angela Merkel, but it is a hard thing to turn a dream into reality. Growing up behind the Iron Curtain, it is only natural that you seek to break down barriers between peoples. Your rule has made Germany a steady force on the continent as it weathers many crises, but you still face criticism. Prove the critics wrong, and you may yet realize your dream.

Your people zealously guard their independence, Theresa May, and it falls to you to provide leadership as they make their own way in the world. A nation unencumbered by entangling alliances does not have to be isolated, for trade with friends will surely bring great benefit to your shores. Provide strong and stable leadership to your people, and they will prosper.

Forward, Emmanuel Macron, and lead your people to a new era. The old institutions have fallen before you, as you have carved out a new place in French politics and seek to lead your people along the Third Way. If you succeed in bringing reform to France while respecting her values, you will have an achievement for the ages. The Republic is on the march!

You lead Brazil in a time of trouble, Michel Temer. You came to power because your predecessor was arrested for corruption, and now clouds of scandal hang above your head as well. Yet you are determined to put this all behind you, and lead Brazil to embark upon an ambitious program of reform. Reform is indeed needed, but will you be the one to provide it and lead Brazil towards a brighter future?

Blessings upon you, Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud, King of Saudi Arabia and Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques. You rule the kingdom of your father with an iron hand, tolerating no dissent to your rule and your faith. But to those who walk in the way of righteousness you extend generosity and grace, as befits a wise ruler such as yourself. Lead your people well, that they might be an example to the world.

Egypt yearns for strong leadership, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, and by God's grace you are the one to provide it. You have chosen to lead your people away from extremism and chaos, providing a steady hand while you reform and improve your ancient land. Like the pharaohs of old, you seek to undertake great building projects that will leave a lasting mark upon your nation. Lead well, and the glory of Egypt will be restored.

There is no time like the present, Justin Trudeau, and at present your people look to you to lead Canada to a better tomorrow. Your father was a giant in Canadian politics, and so it is your task to step out from his shadow and make a grand legacy in your own right. Work hard and listen to others, and when people say the name Trudeau their first thought may be of you.

Your ambition suits you, Malcolm Turnbull, and has prepared you to lead a nation so rich and vast as Australia. With consideration for the past and a desire for the future, you seek to provide your people with both continuity and change. It is a difficult task, but you have never been one to shy away from a challenge.

Your nation is growing, Enrique Peña Nieto, but with growth comes growing pains. You strive to bring greater wealth and security to all your citizens, but the task is not easy in a rich land haunted by poverty and violence. If you can harness the vibrant spirit of Mexico and utilize the strength of a diverse people united, you may yet achieve your goal.

You desire to be a champion of the people, Joko Widodo, but such a position is not easy. Your far-flung nation of 17,000 islands and many diverse peoples will prove difficult to manage, and to add to your worries are the encroaching navies of stronger powers. But your nation is also blessed to sit at a confluence of trade, and if you make the most of your situation your people will prosper.

Hail, Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, unassailable leader of the Republic of Turkey. With the will of the people you have transformed your nation, seeking to revive the ancient glory of your civilization. You tolerate no dissent, and are willing to meet any challenge at home or abroad. Bold leadership can accomplish great things, and with skill you may yet achieve a legacy to rival that of the Sultans.

Argentina is in need of reform, Mauricio Macri, and you have ambitious plans for it. Economic and financial woes must be met with a businessman's acumen, and your background has prepared you for the task. But sometimes necessary medicine is bitter, and staying the course until fruition may prove difficult. Steady yourself and encourage your people, and you may yet lead them to a prosperous future.

Peace be upon you, Hassan Rouhani, devout president of the Islamic Republic of Iran. Your nation is a proud theocracy, forged in the fires of revolution to protect and promote the national version of Shia Islam. Your people seek to create a new world order and establish a global peace, but it will be a difficult task to balance the competing interpretations of this vision. With moderation and devotion, you may achieve your aim.

You are a loyal servant, Shahid Khaqan Abbasi, both to your people and your party. Unexpected events brought you to power, but you are determined to leave your mark. Many challenges face you, but you have assembled a large and talented cabinet to assist you in the daunting task of ruling a nation. Work hard and listen to sound advice, and Pakistan will be grateful for your leadership.

You have come far, Jacob Zuma, rising from humble beginnings to attain the Presidency of South Africa. You faced many struggles: against poverty, against apartheid, against political machinations, and against scandal. Through it all you have persisted, and emerged stronger than ever. May your determination be an example to all who come after you, and may it help you to rule your nation well.

You are a changed man, Muhammadu Buhari, and now you need to bring change to your people as well. Once you were an oppressive dictator, but now you are a reformed democrat comitted to tolerance and transparency. But still you need a fighting spirit, as you will have to combat corruption, poverty, and terrorism. If you triumph over these troubles, you will be celebrated by all Nigeria for all time.

You seek peace, Moon Jae-in, but are haunted by the shadows of war. Your parents escaped the dictatorship of the North during the Korean War, and you yourself fought for human rights against the dictatorship of the South. Now you have been entrusted with the leadership of a free and propserous people, but your journey will not be complete unless you can bring about a lasting peace. May heaven bless your endeavor.

All hail the Supreme Leader, Kim Jong-un, descendent of the Eternal Leaders of Juche Korea, champion of the people, protector of the revolution, and rightful ruler of an indivisible Korea. Your humble servants wait with baited breath for your command, and all Korea seeks to serve your will, whatever the cost. There are many enemies who are jealous of your glory, but with the strength of the people your victory is assured.

The defense of your homeland is your prime concern, Benjamin Netanyahu, and you are willing to do anything to keep your people safe. While you have many critics, your hardline tactics have won you the trust of your embattled nation, which has elected you leader more times than anyone other than its founding father. The way forward may be dangerous, but with a firm resolve, and the blessing of God, you will triumph.

You did not seek the office, Paolo Gentiloni, but a life of public service has been rewarded with the position of Prime Minister. Your fellow ministers have faith in you; now you must earn the trust of your people. Your people seek solutions to the troubles of the day, but they will not be led blindly and will oppose you unless you serve their interests. Lead them well, and you will prove worthy of your position.

Change is in the air in Mexico, AMLO, as you seek to lead your people in a new direction. You promise to fight corruption, bring peace, improve education, and champion equality. Your plan is nothing less than a regeneration of your cherished nation. The problems you face are many, but with determination and the support of your people you will face them head on.

Your sharp tongue often gets you in trouble, Jair Bolsonaro, but when you turned it against the corrupt elite of your nation your people listened and entrusted you to lead them. You have promised to bring renewal and justice to your nation, a tall order in a country plagued by corruption, violence, and poverty. The road ahead is long, but you are determined to make your country great.

Your nation looks to you, Alberto Fernández, to bring about rejuvenation in the land. Argentina suffers from recession and massive public debt, and it needs wise leadership to put things right. If you can provide that leadership, you will make a name for yourself and step out from the shadow of the political bosses who helped orchestrate your rise.

You are an unusual politician for Britain, Boris Johnson, an eccentric both vulgar and erudite, but these are unusual times. Entering the fray at a time of political chaos and uncertainty, you took the reins of a beleaguered party and led it to an electoral triumph not seen in a generation. Now comes the hard task of governing, of fulfilling your promises, and leading your nation towards greater independence. It is a role you believe you were born to play.

It was law but not politics that was your vocation, Giuseppe Conte, but when a divided nation looked to you for leadership you answered the call. You have navigated the rough waters of squabbling partisans, and done much to work towards unity in a fractured polity. But the work is not yet finished, and the people still desire reform. If you can complete the tasks before you, you know that your people will be stronger together.

You have already achieved great things, Cyril Ramaphosa, yet you are not content to rest on your laurels. You played a pivotal role in ending apartheid and have achieved great personal success in business, but now your people need you once more. South Africa faces many difficulties, and if you can overcome them, as you have overcome so many things before, you will earn a lasting place in their hearts.

You like to set lofty goals, Imran Khan, and your current goal is the most ambitious yet. Having achieved victory on the playing field and at the ballot box, you now seek to win in the realm of policy, remaking your nation in a better image. If you can overcome the entrenched interests, your goal of creating a more just and egalitarian state while respecting tradition will be your greatest victory.

You govern a vast and prosperous nation, Scott Morrison, and you bring to the job a history of solid performance. You have often exceeded expectations, but there is always room for improvement. Be careful not to let events get ahead of you, for in this land down under one must always be prepared for the unexpected if one is to thrive.
Demands Loyalty
Likes Civilizations who are their declared friend. Dislikes anyone denouncing his friends and allies. Dislikes anyone who declares a surprise war.
Belt and Road

Likes civilizations who have the same Luxury resources as he does, and will try to collect every Luxury resource available. Dislikes civilizations who have a new Luxury resource he has not yet collected.
Russian Interests
Likes civilizations that aren't competing for the same city-state allegiance. Dislikes civilizations that are directly competing for city-state allegiance.
Hindutva
Likes civilizations who follow the same religion. Dislikes civilizations that try to spread their religion to his empire.
Peace through Deterrence
Likes civilizations with powerful militaries. Dislikes warmongers.
European Union
Likes civilizations that aren't competing for the same city-state allegiance. Dislikes civilizations that are directly competing for city-state allegiance.
Brexit
Likes civilizations from her home continent. Does not like Suzerains of city-states, or civilizations who conquered city-states.
Pro Union
Likes civilizations who are willing to form a long-term alliance. Dislikes anyone denouncing or attacking his friends and allies.
Pro Business
Respects other high income civilizations. Dismisses low income civilizations.
One True Faith
Likes civilizations who follow the same religion. Dislikes civilizations following other religions.
Strength and Stability
Likes civilizations with powerful militaries. Dislikes anyone who declares a surprise war.
Because it's (Present Year)
Likes civilizations with high [ICON_Culture] Culture. Dislikes civilizations with low [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Admires Ambition

Friendly to those civilizations that are ahead of him in [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture. Dislikes backwards civilizations that are lacking in [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Champion of Industry
Tries to build up industry, and likes civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Production] Production.
Naval Supremacy
Tries to build a large navy. Likes civilizations without a large navy. Is distrustful of civilizations with a large navy.
Unity of Purpose

Favors civilizations with the same type of government and civilizations with the same religion. Dislikes civilizations that have different governments, and really dislikes civilizations with different governments of the same era as its own.
Meeting of the Minds
Favors civilizations with the same type of government, dislikes civilizations that have different governments, and really dislikes civilizations with different governments of the same era as its own.
Theocrat
Likes civilizations who follow the same religion. Dislikes civilizations following other religions.
National Interests
Likes civilizations who are willing to form a long-term alliance. Dislikes anyone denouncing or attacking his friends and allies.
Socialist
Likes low income civilizations. Dislikes high income civilizations.
African Union
Likes civilizations that aren't competing for the same city-state allegiance. Dislikes civilizations that are directly competing for city-state allegiance.
Sunshine Policy
Likes civilizations that keep the peace. Dislikes warmongers.
Rocket Man
Has an unhealthy interest in rockets and their (nuclear) payloads. Grudgingly respects other civilizations that project strength with nuclear weapons.
Allies for Israel
Likes civilizations who are willing to form a long-term alliance. Dislikes anyone denouncing or attacking his friends and allies.
Green Sympathies
Likes civilizations that plant forests or found National Parks. Dislikes civilizations that clear features.
Man of the People
Likes those that keep their people happy. Dislikes those who neglect their people.
Ideologue
Favors civilizations with the same type of government, dislikes civilizations that have different governments, and really dislikes civilizations with different governments of the same era as its own.
Fiscally Cautious
Likes Civilizations that trade with his cities. Dislikes high income Civilizations.
Brexit
Likes civilizations from his home continent. Does not like Suzerains of city-states, or civilizations who conquered city-states.
Coalition Builder
Establishes as many Alliances as possible, and likes those who do the same. Dislikes civilizations that don't establish Alliances.
Mediator
Participates in Emergencies and Competitions whenever possible, and likes civilizations who do the same. Dislikes those that ignore Emergencies and Competitions.
Good Neighbor
Will not attack neighbors unless they break a promise to him. Likes those who do not war with neighbors, dislikes those who do.
Pro-Trade
Tries to maximize [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. Likes civilizations that trade with him, dislikes those who do not.

Bolsonaro dislikes your approach to governing

Fernandez is suspicious of your wealth

Khan is dismayed that you fight with your neighbors
Morrison likes civilizations that trade with his
We are great friends. The best.
(You are one of my friends)
You act like a loser. Sad!
(You have denounced one of my friends)
(You have declared a surprise war)
It is well that we can trade as equals.
(You have no Luxuries he wants)
Why do you not trade with China? Don't you know that cooperation is better than competition?
(You have a Luxury he wants)
It is wise of you to look to your own interests, instead of interfering in ours.
(You are not competing over city-states)
That city is under the protection of Russia. You should not meddle in the affairs of others.
(You are competing over city-states)
I am happy to see that we walk the same path towards enlightenment.
(You share his Religion)
We respectfully ask that you cease converting our people. You follow your path, and we will follow ours.
(You are spreading your religion into his cities)
I am happy to see another leader who takes security as seriously as I do.
(You have a strong military)
The path of war leads only to suffering. Do not make the same mistake that we did.
(You are warmongering)
I thank you for not interfering in our project of Union.
(You are not competing over city-states)
It is disgraceful that you would try to break up our Union.
(You are competing over city-states)
We look forward to working with everyone on our continent. Friendship and trade among independent nations is important.
(You share the same home continent)
You should cease interfering in the affairs of others. Every nation ought to be allowed its independence.
(You are conquering or allying with city-states)
Friendship leads to greater integration of nations. I am glad we are friends.
(You are one of my friends)
Your hateful rhetoric has no place in this world.
(You have denounced one of my friends)
I am pleased to see you are someone I can do business with.
(You have a high income)
How can we do business together if your affairs are in such disarray?
(You have a low income)
As-salamu alaykum! You do well to follow the true path.
(You share his Religion)
What hope is there for you, if you continue to reject the true path?
(You do not share his Religion)
There must be tough security measures to secure safety for one's people. I am glad to see you agree.
(You have a strong military)
Betrayal is an ignoble action. We don't forget, and won't forget.
(You have declared a surprise war)
I am happy to find another leader who recognizes the importance of progress.
(You are strong in Culture)
It's 2020. Your old ideas are no longer relevant to today's world.
(You are weak in Culture)
I am glad to see another leader who recognizes the importance of striving to get ahead.
(You are strong in Science and Culture)
You can do better than this. I hope.
(You are weak in Science and Culture)
We both recognize that increasing productivity will provide better opportunities for our people. Perhaps this agreement can develop into a partnership.
(You are strong in Production)
If you neglect your industry, you neglect your nation.
(You are weak in Production)
I am pleased to see you don't threaten our sovereignty with your ships.
(You have a weak navy)
You best keep your large navy on your own shores. We will be watching you.
(You have a strong navy)
I am glad we see things the same. If you follow my lead, we can achieve great things.
(You have the same type of Government)
Disunity creates many problems. If you do not mend your ways, it will lead to disaster.
(You have different types of Government)
There's no substitute for wise policy. I am glad to see you have chosen wisely for your people.
(You have the same type of Government)
Do you actually think you are helping your people with those policies? It will be difficult to work together if you persist in this error.
(You have different types of Government)
As-salamu alaykum! May you be blessed as you walk in the path of righteousness.
(You share his Religion)
To stray from the true path is folly. Submission is the only safe course.
(You do not share his Religion)
I am glad we can work together. It is a dangerous world, and friendship is a shield for us all.
(You are one of my friends)
I am disappointed you do not want to be in league with us and our allies.
(You have denounced one of my friends)
We welcome you to join us in the struggle against all oppressors.
(You have a low income)
Don't you think you have enough? You should start sharing your wealth with others.
(You have a high income)
I am happy to see that you do not interfere in our affairs.
(You are not competing over city-states)
It saddens me that you are interfering where you do not belong.
(You are competing over city-states)
I am constantly working for peace. I am happy to see that you also recognize the value of peace.
(You are keeping the peace)
War brings suffering. Why don't you give peace a chance?
(You are warmongering)
I see you are a nuclear threat as well. I will take this into consideration.
All Korea laughs at your weakness. I ought to lob a missile your way to teach you a lesson.
A friend of Israel is a friend of mine. Let us celebrate our friendship.
(You are one of my friends)
I cannot trust those who oppose my friends. I will watch you, closely.
(You have denounced one of my friends)
I am glad to meet others who share my concern for the environment.
(You are protecting the environment)
We only have one earth. You should treat it better.
(You are damaging the environment)
I am happy to see that you care for your people. That is the first responsibility of true leadership.
(Your people are happy)
You should take better care of your people. The welfare of the people must always come first.
(Your people are unhappy)
You and I agree on the most fundamental questions of government. This is good.
(You have the same type of Government)
You are an idiot. You are leading your people to ruin.
(You have different types of Government)
I am pleased to see that your trade benefits my nation.
(You sent trade routes to them)
I do not trust those with great wealth. I will keep my eye on you.
(You have a high income)
We are glad to cooperate with our neighbors, on equal terms, as an independent nation.
(You share the same home continent)
Your lack of respect for the independence of other nations reflects poorly on your character.
(You are conquering or allying with city-states)
I am glad to see you agree that only collective and coordinated action can help us face the multiple challenges before us.
(You have many alliances)
Why do you go it alone instead of working with others? I hope this is not indicative of deeper anti-social tendencies.
(You do not have enough alliances)
I am glad to see that you are a leader capable of working with others.
(You have joined Emergencies)
Is it that you cannot work with others, or that you do not care? No matter, either way is regrettable.
(You have not joined Emergencies)
I am glad to see you keep the peace with your neighbors.
(You have kept the peace with your neighbors)
Why do you fight with your neighbors? You cannot kill your way to peace.
(You are fighting with your neighbors)
I am glad that you are willing to trade with us.
(You are trading with them)
You really ought to consider trading with us. We have much to offer.
(You are not trading with them)
You want to fight? We will destroy you, and we will win.
To keep our country safe, we must fight you.
You dare threaten us? We are strong enough to stand up and resist.
Safeguarding our interests requires that we make war upon you.
If war is what you want, you must be destroyed, crushed.
If a fight is inevitable, we prefer to strike the first blow.
Our tolerance doesn't mean we won't defend ourselves.
Your actions have become intolerable. Prepare for war.
We will fully defend ourselves in a resolute manner.
Your insufferable actions have forced me to break my pledge never to wage war.
If we must fight to defend our freedom, our values, then we will fight.
We can no longer tolerate your behavior. Prepare for war.
National security is our first duty, and we will do what we must in the face of your aggression.
Your actions threaten our security. Since diplomacy has failed, we must go to war.
You may think us weak, but we have the necessary willingness to win.
I sought to avoid war, but your actions have driven us to fight.
You may say "Temer is very fragile", but this is nonsense! You will see...
You have provoked me for the last time. Let's settle this.
You dare to strike a king? You will pay for this insolence!
Your offenses against the Kingdom have become too great. It is time to pay for your sins.
Anyone who harms Egypt will be wiped from the face of Earth!
Egypt must be protected from the likes of you. We will meet you on the battlefield.
We will fight hard to protect our people. You will not prevail.
War should be the option of last resort, but we have run out of options in dealing with you.
You underestimate Australia. We won't go down without a fight.
Sometimes there are no easy solutions. You have pushed us to this extreme measure.
You will regret this. We will defend our sovereignty to the utmost.
I act only in Mexico's interest. And I have judged that it is in our interest to declare war.
We will defend our shores with the greatest of vigor.
Indonesia cannot be safe so long as your ships swarm the seas. Prepare for war.
You imperialists are all the same. You may attack Turkey, but you cannot defeat us!
You have forced us to act: prepare for war.
With fighting, no one wins. Why do you choose to fight?
A united Argentina is unstoppable. And today, we are united against you.
If you invade our lands, we will drive you out, like we drove out the enemies of the Revolution.
You are the great Satan. As righteous men it is our duty to fight you. Death to you!
You will regret this. We will defend Pakistan to the death.
We have decided that the status quo is unacceptable. It is time for war.
You want war? We are willing to fight and die for South Africa!
You have made an enemy of South Africa. Prepare for war.
I am no stranger to conflict. If you want a fight, you will have one.
I prefer to face my enemies head on. Let's see what you are made of.
Peace is preferable to war, but we will not surrender to tyrants.
I had hoped to avoid war, but you leave me no other choice.
You dotard! I will tame you with fire!
I will crush you beneath my heel. Prepare to die!
We will defend our home with boundless courage. We will win, or die.
We will attack anyone who threatens us. You are a threat.
If necessary, Italy is prepared to fight.
We cannot accept the danger you pose. You must be defeated.
You will regret this. We will defend our sovereignty to the utmost.
I act only in Mexico's interest. And I have judged that it is in our interest to declare war.
You fool. Prepare to be destroyed.
Now we will see who is stronger.
With fighting, no one wins. Why do you choose to fight?
A united Argentina is unstoppable. And today, we are united against you.
If it's a fight you want, it's a fight you'll get. Britain is not easily defeated.
Your behavior has become intolerable. War is the only answer now.
If necessary, Italy is prepared to defend itself.
We cannot accept the danger you pose. You must be defeated.
You want war? We are willing to fight and die for South Africa!
You have made an enemy of South Africa. Prepare for war.
How can you justify this? War is not the answer.
I do not like war, but you have pushed us to it.
I am committed to winning. If you want war, prepare to lose.
As a matter of national security, we must declare war on you.
You? Defeated me? That's fake news!
You? Defeated me? That's fake news!
This is a grave crisis. The Party is defeated. I am defeated. What will become of China?
This is a grave crisis. The Party is defeated. I am defeated. What will become of China?
This is not possible! We are a country of winners, we cannot lose!
This is not possible! We are a country of winners, we cannot lose!
India has suffered occupation before, and like before we will rise again, in time.
India has suffered occupation before, and like before we will rise again, in time.
This is a day of great shame and sadness for Japan.
This is a day of great shame and sadness for Japan.
Today we may be defeated, but neither the chains of dictatorship nor the fetters of oppression can keep down the forces of freedom for long.
Today we may be defeated, but neither the chains of dictatorship nor the fetters of oppression can keep down the forces of freedom for long.

Donald Trump
45th President of the United States

The fourth of five children of a wealthy real estate developer, Donald Trump demonstrated a dogged persistence and shrewd negotioting skill from an early age, leading his father to entrust him with the family business in 1971, when Trump was only 25. Under Trump's leadership the company thrived, growing from a valuation in the millions to one in the billions, in the process making Trump one of the wealthiest men in the country. With a flair for the theatric, Trump branched out of the real estate business into the media, even running a successful TV series.

Long critical of politicians, and often flirting with entering politics himself, Donald Trump finally took the plunge into politics with a run for the presidency in 2016. A polarizing figure from the start, Trump made many enemies, and acolytes, with a blunt, often insulting manner of speech and a campaign focused on unapologetic nationalism. Fortunately for Trump, his opponent in the general election was the only other person as unpopular as he, Hillary Clinton, allowing him to pull out an upset victory by winning a clear majority of electoral votes. In his short tenure Trump has made many changes, pulling out of treaties he deemed detrimental to American interests, rescinding regulations, taking a new tack in foreign policy, and promising to work for reform in taxes and law. His administration has been marred by controversy and scandal, most prominently questions of ties to Russia, and it remains to be seen if he can put this behind him and establish a legacy of greatness as he promised his supporters.
